content.text:
# Draft:Eihwar

Eihwar is a French duo associated with the contemporary wave of Viking music, blending pagan and Nordic folk with electronic, dance-oriented production. The band describe their approach as "Viking War Trance," combining tribal chants, ritual percussion and modern electronics.
History
Eihwar was founded in 2023 by French musicians Asrunn and Mark. Early videos and live performances with a ritualistic character drew attention across the folk/metal scene.
In 2024, the duo signed with the independent French label Season of Mist and released their debut album, Viking War Trance, which received coverage and reviews from several music outlets.
Musical style
Critics and interviews frequently associate Eihwar with Viking music aesthetics and themes, situating the duo within the wider pagan/Nordic folk revival. Their self-described "Viking War Trance" merges Nordic folk timbres, shamanic drums and dancefloor-ready electronics, often characterized as immersive and entrancing.
Live performances and festivals
Eihwar have appeared at several European festivals:
* Hellfest Open Air (France, 2024).
* Wacken Open Air (Germany, 2025).
* Tuska Open Air (Finland, 2025).
* Midgardsblot (Norway, 2025).
* Resurrection Fest (Spain, 2025).
Discography
Studio albums
* Viking War Trance (Season of Mist, 2024)
Reception
Wall of Sound described Viking War Trance as "a sonic journey between tribal trance and ancestral folklore" (8.5/10), while RAMzine highlighted how the duo "merge modern energy with Nordic authenticity". Distorted Sound called it "a convincing debut that carves a singular path within the folk and pagan scene".
Members
* Asrunn – vocals, percussion
* Mark – vocals, programming
External links
* [https://www.eihwar.com Official website]
* [https://eihwar.bandcamp.com Bandcamp]
